intro: Unisema obliquata, commonly known as the oblique unisema, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass species. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native environment, including drought resistance and efficient photosynthesis. Unisema obliquata is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
